title: 104_s1089
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Lake Champlain Zebra Mussel Control Act of 1995" and refers to the prevention and control of zebra mussel infestation in Lake Champlain. The Act, known as the "Lake Champlain Zebra Mussel Control Act of 1995," addresses the unintentional introduction and infestation of zebra mussels in the Great Lakes, Hudson River, and Lake Champlain. It emphasizes the need for quick action to establish zebra mussel controls in Lake Champlain. Additionally, amendments are made to the National Ballast Water Control Program to include Lake Champlain and other water bodies, and ex officio members are added to the Aquatic Nuisance Species Task Force. Amendments are made to include the Lake Champlain Basin Program in the Aquatic Nuisance Species Task Force and to the Aquatic Nuisance Species Program by adding Lake Champlain after Great Lakes. SEC. 3. VOLUNTARY GUIDELINES.

The Task Force will develop voluntary guidelines for controlling the spread of the zebra mussel through recreational activities like boating and fishing, to be issued by the Secretary within a year of enactment.

SEC. 4. STATE AND WATERSHED AQUATIC NUISANCE SPECIES MANAGEMENT PLANS. Section 1204(a) (16 U.S.C. 4724(a)) is amended to include watershed organizations in State or Watershed Plans. The amendment also specifies the inclusion of watershed organizations in various subparagraphs within the State or watershed. The amendment to Section 1204(a) (16 U.S.C. 4724(a)) includes watershed organizations in State or Watershed Plans, defining a watershed organization as an entity with jurisdiction over watershed management under Federal and State law. SEC. 5. SEA GRANT COLLEGE DESIGNATION.

The University of Vermont in Burlington, Vermont is designated as a sea grant college under the National Sea Grant College Program Act. The Secretary shall make this designation within 30 days of the enactment of the Lake Champlain Zebra Mussel Control Act of 1995.

SEC. 6. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 1301 (16 U.S.C. 4741) is amended to update the years referenced in subsections (a)(3) and (b). Additionally, changes are made to subsection (b) including the insertion of the Lake Champlain Research Consortium in paragraph (3) and the inclusion of grants to colleges for agriculture and mechanic arts in paragraph (4)(A). In section 1301 (16 U.S.C. 4741), amendments are made to update the years referenced in subsections (a)(3) and (b). Changes include inserting the Lake Champlain basin in paragraph (3) and increasing funding from $2,000,000 to $4,000,000 in paragraph (7). Subsection (c) is updated to cover the years 1996 through 2000.
